name: Americana Volume 1 Online Trivia | General | 10 Questions

questions.text: This artist painted many pictures of key events in American history. He is best known for his painting of the signing of the Declaration of Independence.
questions.explanation:
John Trumbull.

	Wood did the well-known 'American Gothic'. Homer and West were prominent American artists.

questions.text: This revolutionary period artist was best known as a painter of portraits, including many of the first American presidents.
questions.explanation:
Gilbert Stuart.

	Remington is best known for his work in the American West. Whistler is one of the most famous American painters.

questions.text: One of the most famous pictures in American history is of Washington crossing the Delaware. Name the painter.
questions.explanation:
Emanuel Leutze.

	Rodin was a master - but not in this instance. Same is true of Chagall. Rockwell is famed for his slice-of-life paintings of America

questions.text: Francis Scott Key was inspired to write the 'Star Spangled Banner' when he observed an ongoing battle in this war
questions.explanation:
War of 1812.

	He observed the shelling of Fort McHenry

questions.text: 'The Battle Hymn of the Republic' was an unofficial anthem of Union soldiers in the Civil War. Who was the lyric writer?
questions.explanation:
Julia Ward Howe.

	Emmett is apparently the author of 'Dixie', which was the comparable anthem for the Confederacy. Sousa, 'the March King', created 'Stars and Stripes Forever'.

questions.text: This American composer created many prominent tunes, including 'Swanee River' and 'My Old Kentucky Home'
questions.explanation:
Stephen Foster.

	Foster had a tough life: not much money or recognition - and a short life. Joplin is a key figure in ragtime music

questions.text: Which patriot delivered a speech that asked 'Is life so dear or peace so sweet as to be purchased at the price of chains and slavery'?
questions.explanation:
Patrick Henry.

	This is from the speech which states (a moment later) 'give me liberty or give me death'

questions.text: Who wrote that 'Governments are instituted among men, deriving their just powers from the consent of the governed'?
questions.explanation:
Thomas Jefferson.

	It's from the Declaration of Independence, describing the role of government in protecting 'inalienable rights'.

questions.text: Which revolutionary patriot wrote: 'These are the times that try men's souls. The summer soldier and sunshine patriot will, in this crisis, shrink from the service of their country ...'?
questions.explanation:
Tom Paine.

	Paine was a prolific writer during the revolutionary period

questions.text: Who said that 'This nation under God shall have a new birth of freedom'?
questions.explanation:
Abraham Lincoln.

	From the Gettysburg Address
